page.title: 01Leckford and Stockbridge
page.content: The area is situated to the north east of the village of Stockbridge, in the Test Valley District of northern Hampshire,and is composed of chalk.The River Test flows through on its course to Southampton and is renowned for its trout fishing The people are mainly employed in agriculture or work in the nearby towns. The area comprises parts of three parishes,Leckford,mostly owned by The John Lewis Partnership,Longstock and Stockbridge. There are good road communications to the surrounding towns of Andover, Winchester,Romsey and Salisbury.There is one bus service linking Andover and Stockbridge.The railway link from Andover to Southampton closed in the 1960s.
